newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria's Kanotrans to buy 47 pct of Alen Mak.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria's Kanotrans to buy 47 pct of Alen Mak.

text.p: The supervisory board of Bulgaria's privatisation agency approved the sale of 47 percent of Plovdiv-based cosmetics firm Alen Mak to Varna-based Kanotrans OOD for $18.3 million, the agency said on Thursday.
The deal must be approved by the cabinet.
The supervisory board also approved the sale of a 55 percent stake in brewer Plevensko Pivo to its managers.

No sum was specified but 50 percent of the payment will be made in dollar-denominated domestic bonds known as ZUNKs, and 50 percent in cash. The sale must also be approved by the cabinet. -- Sofia Newsroom +359-2 91188, 981 4145
